item.title: Kayla add a quote by Benjamin Disraeli
item.description: "Never apologize for showing feeling. When you do so, you apologize for the truth." -- Benjamin Disraeli

item.title: Kayla add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You must write every single day of your life... You must lurk in libraries and climb the stacks like ladders to sniff books like perfumes and wear books like hats upon your crazy heads... may you be in love every day for the next 20,000 days. And out of that love, remake a world." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Kayla add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "When writing a novel, that's pretty much entirely what life turns into: 'House burned down. Car stolen. Cat exploded. Did 1500 easy words, so all in all it was a pretty good day." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Kayla add a quote by Ariel Gore
item.description: "It is a great paradox and a great injustice that writers write because we fear death and want to leave something indestructible in our wake and, at the same time, are drawn to all the things that kill: whiskey and cigarettes, unprotected sex, and deep-fried burritos." -- Ariel Gore

item.title: Kayla add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "My witness is the empty sky." -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Kayla add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I am enough of an artist to draw freely upon my imagination. Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited. Imagination encircles the world." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Kayla add a quote by E.L. Doctorow
item.description: "Writing is a socially acceptable form of schizophrenia." -- E.L. Doctorow

item.title: Kayla add a quote by Lauren Bacall
item.description: "Imagination is the highest kite that can fly." -- Lauren Bacall

item.title: Kayla add a quote by Moli
item.description: "Writing is like prostitution. First you do it for love, and then for a few close friends, and then for money." -- Moli

item.title: Kayla add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You must stay drunk on writing so reality cannot destroy you." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Kayla add a quote by Merit Antares
item.description: "The only cure for writer's block is insomnia. " -- Merit Antares

item.title: Kayla add a quote by Burton Rascoe
item.description: "What no wife of a writer understands is that a writer is working when he's staring out the window." -- Burton Rascoe

item.title: Kayla add a quote by Agatha Christie
item.description: "The best time for planning a book is while you're doing the dishes. " -- Agatha Christie

item.title: Kayla add a quote by Sinclair Lewis
item.description: "It is impossible to discourage the real writers - they don't give a damn what you say, they're going to write." -- Sinclair Lewis

item.title: Kayla add a quote by E.B. White
item.description: "Writing is both mask and unveiling." -- E.B. White

item.title: Kayla add a quote by James Norman Hall
item.description: "Loafing is the most productive part of a writer's life. " -- James Norman Hall

item.title: Kayla add a quote by Franklin P. Adams
item.description: "Having imagination, it takes you an hour to write a paragraph that, if you were unimaginative, would take you only a minute. Or you might not write the paragraph at all. " -- Franklin P. Adams

item.title: Kayla add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Find out the reason that commands you to write; see whether it has spread its roots into the very depth of your heart; confess to yourself you would have to die if you were forbidden to write." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Kayla add a quote by Samuel Butler
item.description: "Books want to be born: I never make them. They come to me and insist on being written, and on being such and such. " -- Samuel Butler

item.title: Kayla add a quote by Gloria Steinem
item.description: "Writing is the only thing that when I do it, I don't feel I should be doing something else." -- Gloria Steinem

item.title: Kayla add a quote by John Grisham
item.description: "Don't compromise yourself - you're all you have." -- John Grisham

item.title: Kayla add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is no friend as loyal as a book." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Kayla add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Kayla add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Kayla add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Writing is magic, as much the water of life as any other creative art. The water is free. So drink. Drink and be filled up." -- Stephen King

item.title: Kayla add a quote by Erica Jong
item.description: "Beware of the man who denounces woman writers; his penis is tiny and he cannot spell." -- Erica Jong

item.title: Kayla add a quote by Isak Dinesen
item.description: "I start with a tingle, a kind of feeling of the story I will write. Then come the characters, and they take over, they make the story." -- Isak Dinesen

item.title: Kayla add a quote by Andre Gide
item.description: "What would a narrative of happiness be like? All that can be described is what prepares it, and then what destroys it." -- Andre Gide

item.title: Kayla add a quote by Meg Cabot
item.description: "Write the kind of story you would like to read. People will give you all sorts of advice about writing, but if you are not writing something you like, no one else will like it either." -- Meg Cabot

item.title: Kayla add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "You don't write because you want to say something, you write because you have something to say." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald
